Function Documentation

int son_close_array ( son_t *  h)

Closes an array while creating or appending a SON file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
Returns
Less than zero if there was an error
See also
son_create(), son_open_array()
int son_close_data ( son_t *  h)

Closes a data object that has previously been opened using son_open_data().

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
Returns
Less than zero on error
See also
son_open_data(), son_write_open_data()
int son_close_obj ( son_t *  h)

Closes an object while creating or appending a SON file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle

The function son_close_obj() is used to close the object.

See also
son_create(), son_close_obj()
int son_open_array ( son_t *  h,
const char *  key 
)

Opens a new array while creating or appending a SON file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
keyThe key for the new array
Returns
Less then zero for an error

The function son_close_array() is used to close the array value.

See also
son_create(), son_close_array()
int son_open_data ( son_t *  h,
const char *  key 
)

Opens a data object for writing. The son_write_open_data() function is used to write data to the object. This function can be used when the data is not immediately availabe in RAM (for example, needs to be read from a file).

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
keyThe key for the new object
Returns
Less than zero for an error
1 son_t son;
2 int fd;
3 int bytes;
4 char buffer[16];
5 
6 son_open_data(&son, "data");
7 while( (bytes = read(fd, buffer, 16)) > 0 ){
8  son_write_open_data(buffer, bytes);
9 }
10 son_close_data(&son);
See also
son_close_data(), son_write_open_data()
int son_open_obj ( son_t *  h,
const char *  key 
)

Starts a new object while creating or appending values to a SON file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handle
keyThe key for the new object
Returns
Less than zero for an error (see h->err)
See also
son_create()
int son_write_data ( son_t *  h,
const char *  key,
const void *  data,
son_size_t  size 
)

Writes a true value to the file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
keyThe key to associate with the value
dataA pointer to the data to save
sizeThe number of bytes of data to save
Returns
Less than zero on an error
int son_write_false ( son_t *  h,
const char *  key 
)

Writes a false value to the file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
keyThe key to associate with the value
Returns
Less than zero on an error

)

Writes a float point value to the file.

Parameters

keyThe key to associate with the value
fnumThe value to save
Returns
Less than zero on an error

)

Writes a null value to the file.

Returns
Less than zero on an error
int son_write_num ( son_t *  h,
const char *  key,
s32  num 
)

Writes a signed number to the file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
keyThe key to associate with the value
numThe value to save
Returns
Less than zero on an error
int son_write_open_data ( son_t *  h,
const void *  data,
son_size_t  size 
)

Writes data to the file. This must be called after son_open_data().

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
dataA pointer to the data to write
sizeThe number of bytes to write
Returns
Less than zero on an error
int son_write_str ( son_t *  h,
const char *  key,
const char *  str 
)

Writes a string to the file.

Parameters
hA pointer to the handler
keyThe key to associate with the string
strThe string to save
Returns
Less than zero on an error
